data.title: Quaint little theatre in the heart of downtown Melbourne
data.text: The Melbourne Civic Theatre is a small, cozy theatre that makes for a great night out.  There are no bad seats as the theatre is small and intimate.  They have a snack bar, great staff, and the building is elegantly decorated.  If you are looking for a fun night out in downtown Melbourne enjoy dinner at one of the fine restaurants around the corner, enjoy a show, and then have ice cream right next store or go out for late night drinks.  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Refreshing!
data.text: If you are looking for a refreshing night out in Melbourne I would recommend MCT. The actors do not disappoint and you receive a more intimate of a setting than most theaters in the area.

data.title: Good Theater
data.text: Very surprised by the level of abilities of the performers.  Didn't expect this level of professionalism from a local theater group.  Great theater!

data.title: Great Change from Musicals
data.text:
We've seen about 10 shows here. Some we've seen twice because they were just so enjoyable like Jacob Marley's Christmas Carol.
The location is within a downtown shopping gallery. We've given up trying to park by the stores due to limited spaces on the weekends (shows are Fri-Sun except a little adjustment during Christmastime) so now we just park across the street on the north side in the city's parking garage. If you park on the store side, you then go through a walkway until you end up at the theater.
Buying tickets in person is pretty straightforward. Just go during box office hours. Online it isn't that hard once you know where to click and then click on the picture of the seats. I only mention this because it wasn't self-explanatory on the page. 
We find the the seats have good views--it is an intimate setting--and the prices reasonable considering all that must go into sets & costumes. It always amazes us how each play is distinct in both those features.
The volume & lighting are also very well handled. As are any special effects.
The actors are superb. Simply superb. Amazing they (and support crew) are not paid. They must truly love their craft.

data.title: Cutting Edge Performances
data.text: Small, intimate theater delivering cutting edge plays with very good local talent. Well organized and friendly, this venue offers an excellent thinking person's date night or evening with friends. Going solo? No worries, it won't be for long. Regular crowd is very friendly.

data.title: Tartuffe
data.text: This was our first visit to the Melbourne Civic Theater. Upon entering there is a small lobby where you can sit and wait until it is time to be seated. They have a small concessions window where you can get a drink or even a small snack to enjoy while watching the show. A 50/50 raffle is called mid show for those who are interested. This is a small production and they get their bang for their buck. The show we viewed was Tartuffe. The story of a rich man who is so entranced by a holy man that his families concerns cause him no worry until the situation becomes intense. It was a very good performance and I will be delighted to see another show  in the future.

data.title: Tartuffe
data.text:
Visited this theatre on a holiday from England 
I came over to Melbourne to visit my GreatAunt and she is a regular here

I enjoyed my visit here because of the atmosphere in the lobby everyone is very friendly

As for the show it was well directed and presented and the comedic value was very good.

If I ever got the opportunity to visit Florida again I'd visit here too 

Highly recommended

data.title: Tartuffe
data.text:
Went to this little theatre while on holiday from England 
I was out in Palm Bay visiting my Great Aunt and my Aunt is a regular to this theatre and wanted to show us what it was like!.

I really enjoyed the show I thought it was very funny and all the seats seems to have a great view of the production.

I'd highly recommend going whether your a local that's unsure or your on holiday/vacation

data.title: Little Theater with high quality Productions
data.text:
Went recently with another couple to see Tartuffe, and what an entertaining show it was.  Moliere's 300+ year-old plot was classic, and still very applicable to people today.  The dress and set were of high quality, as was the professionalism of the actors.  
The theater has only five rows of about 20 comfortable seats, so you are so close to the actors that you can hear every word without effort and see every nuance of expression.  Our first show we saw there was "Dracula", we were in the front row, and some of the fake blood spattered on my wife's shoes.  Talk about an intimate little theater!  Fantastic.

data.title: Tartuffe
data.text: Six of us went to see this show last eve.  Don't let the name discourage you.  It was a comedy and so well done.  They had us laughing  the full 2 hours.  The period costumes were perfect.  The cast was better than Broadway and it is right down town in Melbourne, FL.

data.title: Wonderful, intimate little theatre.
data.text: Top quality plays with seasoned local actors.  I've had season tickets for three years, and haven't been disappointed yet.

data.title: Melbourne Civic theater, a delightful small cozy theater!
data.text: We really enjoy every production we have ever seem at the Melbourne Civic theater, a delightful small cozy theater!

data.title: Each Seat is a Good Seat.
data.text: The theater is small for an intimate evening with the actors/actresses. The stage is at floor level and so if your tickets placed you on the first row, you will be inches from the action.  Cool, right? My wife and I are regular patrons. Their choice of comedies, farces, musicals and the staff professionalism from stage crew (carpenters, light and sound techs) to enthusiastic actors makes us starve for more.  MCT is a jewel among the Brevard Arts community.  Next scheduled play is Tartuffe by Moliere, a satiric comedy and a classic for March and April 2016. Give it a try.  See you there!

data.title: The best
data.text: Melbourne is just so lucky to have MCT! We have followed the director, Peg Girard, to different locations knowing what a remarkable product she delivers. As we are regulars, we have always been entertained. They have readings as well as the full stage productions, and they are equally as engaging. Thank you for entertaining us and amazing us with your talent!

data.title: Easy and adorable
data.text: Went to see underpants here on a Friday night. Easy free parking across the street. Arrived early to see a small crowd drinking wine from soppy cups (really) and chatting in what was the waiting area, but looked like someone's old time parlor. The theater seats aren't that comfortable, but they provide a tiny pillow for each one and it's fine. There isn't a bad seat in the tiny house, the actors were great, the vibe is soooo relaxed. Exit to the empty streets and uncrowded parking garage and drift home. We had a grand time :)

data.title: Best little playhous in Melbourne
data.text:
If you want a fun, fun night taking in a play with some very talented actors, go to the Civic Theatre!
We saw their play on Jacob Marley and it was exemplary! What a great night. So much fun to see what they create.
Looking forward to the next one! We'll be back!

data.title: Lots of local talent
data.text: This is a small theatre - very cozy.  We have lots of great local talent.  It is located in downtown Melbourne, good restaurants and bars nearby.

data.title: Upclose and personal
data.text: With less than 100 seats, everyone gets a great view. The seats were fine, if a little dated -- the little pillow they provide helps. The acoustics were good.  The lighting, sound, and other technical aspects of the production worked well. The stage is small, but the sets were well done.

data.title: Great way to spend a hot Summer afternoon!
data.text: We went to a matinee and had a wonderful time.  The Melbourne Civic Theatre is so refreshing and so Melbourne. How they can get such great scenery in a small space is amazing.  Being a small theatre you almost feel as if you are part of the play. The local actors put their hearts into every performance.  One of those not to miss attractions in Melbourne Florida.

data.title: Best little theater ever
data.text: Every show I've seen here has been exquisitely done.  There are no bad seats.  The price is right, the people are friendly. I've seen them hold a show a few minutes for ticket holders who got lost on the way to the theater.
